article_text:
Spectrum Internet with Speeds up to a Gig Now Available to More Than 640 Additional Homes and Businesses

LEBANON, Ky. — Spectrum, the #1 rural internet provider in the nation*, today announced the expansion of its fiber broadband network to bring Spectrum Internet, Mobile, TV and Voice services to more than 640 additional homes and businesses in previously unserved or underserved areas of Marion County including locations near Bradfordsville, Gravel Switch and Lebanon.

Our multi-year rural construction initiative is driven by more than $7 billion in private investment from Spectrum and will ultimately add an additional 100,000+ miles of fiber network infrastructure and deliver symmetrical and multi-gigabit speeds to more than 1.7 million new locations across the country.

“Spectrum is bringing gigabit broadband to rural communities in Kentucky and across America,” said Heather Day, Area Vice President for Spectrum’s Kentucky Management Area. “Our investment is providing residents and small businesses superior connectivity at highly competitive prices, backed by a team of skilled local technicians and 100% U.S.-based customer service.”

Local residents and business owners should visit spectrumruralexpansion.com to learn more about when their home or business may be able to receive Spectrum services.

“Spectrum’s latest broadband network expansion is poised to make a huge impact in our community by providing internet access for residents that have long been without,” said State Rep. Sarge Pollock. “From our most rural neighbors to businesses and schools, everyone will benefit from improved connectivity and the associated opportunities it will provide.

Spectrum Internet delivers speeds up to 1 Gbps and Advanced WiFi for residential and business customers, featuring starting speeds of 500 Mbps, with no modem fees, data caps or contracts. The company has also begun a network evolution that will provide gigabit upstream speeds and multiple gigabit download speeds across its entire 41-state service area.

Spectrum Internet exceeded advertised download and upload speeds for all tiers measured — even during peak weeknight usage between 7 and 11 p.m. — according to the FCC’s most recent “Measuring Broadband America Fixed Broadband Report.”

“As a lifelong resident of Marion County, I know how important it is for my friends and neighbors to stay connected with each other as well as life beyond the county line,” said David Daugherty, Marion County Judge Executive. “Spectrum is helping us stay connected in an increasingly digital world through its high-speed internet access with affordability options for those in need.”

Bundle and Save: Internet and Mobile Services

Along with multiple broadband options, Spectrum Internet customers can now bundle their service with Spectrum Mobile for greater savings and convenience. Spectrum Mobile is the nation’s fastest-growing mobile provider** with Unlimited lines starting at just $30 a month. Bundling these services together provides enhanced value and gives customers seamless connectivity inside and outside the home with the fastest speeds. Spectrum offers a savings calculator to show how much can be saved by switching to Spectrum.

More Savings with Spectrum TV and Streaming

Spectrum TV plans offer additional ways for customers to save money. Spectrum TV plans provide access to the most popular streaming apps - a retail value of up to $125 per month - at no additional cost. Streaming apps include the Disney+, Hulu Bundle and the ESPN Unlimited plan, HBO Max Basic With Ads, Paramount+ Essential, Peacock Premium with Ads, AMC+ with Ads, ViX Premium With Ads, Tennis Channel and FOX One, with more apps including Discovery+ with Ads and BET+ coming soon.

* Based on December 2022 FCC Broadband Data Collection locations.

** Based on 1Q 2024 subscriber data among top 3 carriers.

*** iOS (App Store) and Android (Google Play) average ratings as of July 1, 2024. Apps must have at least 150k reviews through combination of iOS & Android store reviews as of July 1, 2024.

About Spectrum

Spectrum is a suite of advanced communications services offered by Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ:CHTR), a leading broadband connectivity company available to 58 million homes and small to large businesses across 41 states. Founded in 1993, Charter has evolved from providing cable TV to streaming, and from high-speed Internet to a converged broadband, WiFi and mobile experience. Over the Spectrum Fiber Broadband Network and supported by our 100% U.S.-based employees, the Company offers Seamless Connectivity and Entertainment with Spectrum Internet®, Mobile, TV and Voice products.

More information can be found at corporate.charter.com.

Media Contact

Wes Shirley, Wes.Shirley@charter.com

article_text:
Spectrum’s investment in early-career talent development has received national recognition, with the Company’s Internship Program recently earning a spot on Vault’s 2026 Internships Rankings for Software Engineering & Development.

What Sets Spectrum's Internship Experience Apart

Interns at Spectrum don’t just observe – they contribute. Students in the Company’s 10-week, paid summer internship program have the opportunity to kick-start their careers while getting valuable hands-on experience. With internships available on teams across the Company, students can explore early career opportunities in areas like marketing, sales, data analysis, computer science and human resources in addition to tech-focused roles.

Here’s what college students can expect from an internship at Spectrum:

Meaningful, real-world projects. Interns apply classroom learning to essential business functions that drive the Company forward.

Mentorship and professional development. Every intern is paired with a mentor and has access to development workshops and learning resources.

Exposure to teams across the organization. Interns collaborate with multiple departments, building broad professional networks.

Opportunities to develop specialized skills and help tackle challenges central to telecommunications. For Software Engineering & Development interns, this means coding and troubleshooting.

A culture that values learning and connection. Many interns have started – and continued – their careers with Spectrum as full-time employees.

Vault’s 2026 rankings are based on surveys completed by thousands of current and former interns during summer 2025. The rankings highlight programs that deliver the most valuable, hands-on experiences across nearly 250 companies and 30 categories.

“This is a special form of recognition for us because it’s based on our interns' feedback about their personal experience,” said Jake Perlman, Spectrum’s Executive Vice President, Chief Technology & Information Officer. “It confirms the experience we’re giving students is hands-on, meaningful and valuable.”

Interested in joining the Spectrum Internship Program for summer 2026? Check out the Company’s university and early career opportunities to learn more and apply for open intern roles.

Spectrum Internet with Speeds up to a Gig Now Available to More Than 3,200 Additional Homes and Businesses

SPRINGFIELD, Ky. — Spectrum, the #1 rural internet provider in the nation*, today announced the expansion of its fiber broadband network to bring Spectrum Internet, Mobile, TV and Voice services to more than 3,200 additional homes and businesses in previously unserved or underserved areas of Washington County including locations near Mackville, Springfield and Willisburg.

Our multi-year rural construction initiative is driven by more than $7 billion in private investment from Spectrum and will ultimately add an additional 100,000+ miles of fiber network infrastructure and deliver symmetrical and multi-gigabit speeds to more than 1.7 million new locations across the country.

“Spectrum is bringing gigabit broadband to rural communities in Kentucky and across America,” said Heather Day, Area Vice President for Spectrum’s Kentucky Management Area. “Our investment is providing residents and small businesses superior connectivity at highly competitive prices, backed by a team of skilled local technicians and 100% U.S.-based customer service.”

Local residents and business owners should visit spectrumruralexpansion.com to learn more about when their home or business may be able to receive Spectrum services.

“My district is home to hardworking families, small businesses, and farms that now have access to dependable, high-speed internet they can count on. With this expanded connectivity, our communities are better equipped to stay connected, remain competitive, and grow,” said State Rep. Kim King. “Spectrum’s partnership is opening doors — from improving access to local health services and supporting modern agricultural practices to enabling innovation and new opportunities for the next generation.”

Spectrum Internet delivers speeds up to 1 Gbps and Advanced WiFi for residential and business customers, featuring starting speeds of 500 Mbps, with no modem fees, data caps or contracts. The company has also begun a network evolution that will provide gigabit upstream speeds and multiple gigabit download speeds across its entire 41-state service area.

Spectrum Internet exceeded advertised download and upload speeds for all tiers measured — even during peak weeknight usage between 7 and 11 p.m. — according to the FCC’s most recent “Measuring Broadband America Fixed Broadband Report.”

“Growing up in rural Kentucky, I’ve seen how limited connectivity can hold back our schools, businesses, and families,” said Timothy Graves, Washington County Judge Executive. “Spectrum’s recent expansion is bringing high-speed internet to areas of our community that have long been underserved, strengthening our county, and creating new opportunities for residents who call Washington County home.”
